title: How to Look Skinny in a Bodycon Dress

steps.title: Belts help your frame look a lot slimmer.
steps.content: Belts help your frame look a lot slimmer. Bodycon dresses are already super form-fitting—a belt just takes the garment to the next level. Arrange and cinch the belt along the skinniest section of your waist to give your outfit an extra slimming, flattering touch. [1] X Research source Don’t finish off your outfit with any elastic or tight-fitting belts. Since bodycon dresses are already form-fitting, tight belts can create unwanted folds around your waist and stomach.

steps.title: Pick out off-the-shoulder or low-neck dresses.
steps.content: Pick out off-the-shoulder or low-neck dresses. These garments help draw the eye upward, focusing on your neck and shoulders instead of your lower body. To really make a statement, slip on a bold necklace or a stylish pair of earrings. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Long-line cardigans and kimono-style cover-ups make your form look slimmer.
steps.content: Long-line cardigans and kimono-style cover-ups make your form look slimmer. Simply shrug on your cover-up over your bodycon dress—it adds a nice, casual touch to your outfit, too! [3] X Research source Long-line cardigans go past your hips, with some trailing as far as mid-calf.

steps.title: Shapewear helps smooth out your form under your dress.
steps.content: Shapewear helps smooth out your form under your dress. Bodycon dresses are very skin-tight, which can make them a bit intimidating to wear. Shapewear is here to help! Slide on a pair of slimming boy shorts, briefs, camis, or full-body undergarments before slipping into your bodycon dress—this helps your dress look extra flattering and slimming. [4] X Research source [5] X Expert Source Natalie Tincher Style Strategist & Wardrobe Specialist Expert Interview. 13 August 2020. You can find shapewear online, or at most clothing or department stores. Keep in mind that shapewear won't help a dress fit better. You should always choose dresses that move with your body, and don't pull or pucker. [6] X Expert Source Natalie Tincher Style Strategist & Wardrobe Specialist Expert Interview. 13 August 2020.

steps.title: Shades of black help you look a lot slimmer.
steps.content: Shades of black help you look a lot slimmer. The dark color helps conceal any folds and creases, and creates a really slimming, flattering effect throughout your outfit. [7] X Research source Dresses with dark side panels, like black or navy blue, also create a slimming effect. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Thin fabrics don’t look that smooth, and aren’t super flattering.
steps.content: Thin fabrics don’t look that smooth, and aren’t super flattering. That’s where thick materials come in handy! [9] X Research source Canvas, denim, corduroy, suede, and polyester fleece are some great examples of thick fabric. [10] X Research source Wool, tweed, and chenille fabrics are also good options.

steps.title: Long dresses are stylish on almost every body type.
steps.content: Long dresses are stylish on almost every body type. Shorter dresses can draw more emphasis to your thighs, and don’t offer a lot of wiggle room to work with. That’s okay—try on a longer dress for size and see how it fits. [11] X Research source This isn’t to say that short dresses are out of the question! At the end of day, pick out a garment that you feel most happy and confident in.

steps.title: Choose a bra that fits you well, so your bust doesn’t sag.
steps.content: Choose a bra that fits you well, so your bust doesn’t sag. Believe it or not, the majority of women wear bras that don’t fit correctly. Double-check your bra size and slip into an undergarment that fully supports your bust. [12] X Research source When your bust sags, your dress tends to look larger and less flattering.

steps.title: Low-cut vamp heels point along the toe.
steps.content: Low-cut vamp heels point along the toe. This helps your legs look longer and slimmer, which, in turn, spreads to the rest of your outfit. [13] X Research source Low-vamp heels look especially great with shorts, skirts, cropped pants, and dresses.

steps.title: Posture helps your frame look longer.
steps.content: Posture helps your frame look longer. Plus, walking and standing with good posture is also great for your health! [14] X Research source Stand with your back tall and straight while sucking your stomach in. Then, center your balance along the balls of your feet, while keeping your head level.
